Package org.grapheditor.properties

This package contains classes that are used to manage the programs and graphs settings.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ChangeDisplayQuickMenuListListener Object that implements this interface can be added to GlobalProperties to listen for changes on which quck menus that is going to be displayed.
LatestFilesPropertyChangeListener A listener that can be added to GlobalProperties to listen for opening of new files.
PropertiesModule A module that contains functionallity to modify settings for something.
 

Class Summary
GlobalGraphDrawingProperties This is a property change module which implements the PropertiesModule interface.
GlobalLookAndFeelProperties This is a property change module which implements the PropertiesModule interface.
GlobalProperties This implements the design pattern singelton.
GlobalPropertiesDialog A dialog that extends PropertiesDialog and is used for global settings.
GraphBackgroundProperties This is a property change module wich implements the PropertiesModule interface.
GraphDefaultColorProperties This is a property change module which implements the PropertiesModule interface.
GraphDefaultVertexShapeProperties This is a property change module which implements the PropertiesModule interface.
GraphInsertVertexShapeProperties This is a property change module which implements the PropertiesModule interface.
GraphProperties This class represnts properties for a graph.
GraphPropertiesDialog A dialog that extends PropertiesDialog and is used for graph settings.
PropertiesDialog A general properties dialog that are extended by both GlobalPropertiesDialog and GraphPropertiesDialog.
 

Package org.grapheditor.properties Description

This package contains classes that are used to manage the programs and graphs settings. The class GlobalProperties uses the design pattern singelton and represents the global settings concern the whole program. GraphProperties is the corresponding class for settings that belong to a graph like for example the backround color. There is also classes that represents graphical components to change settings. These implements the interface PropertiesModule so it is possible to put them inside a settings dialog in an easy way.
